summary: For the 2020 Census, the Census Bureau originally planned to phase in technology and third-party data sources to build its address list—reducing the need to go door-to-door. The Bureau estimated it could update 75% of its address list this way, reducing costs by $900 million. However, the Bureau has not evaluated the accuracy of its approach, which involves comparing aerial images to data in the...
title: 2020 Census: Bureau Needs to Better Leverage Information to Achieve Goals of Reengineered Address Canvassing
